Half-Life is the story about a guy who has the worst day at the office ever. The next time you think you've had a bad day at work, remember, you're not getting shot at by the military, shot, strangled, electrocuted, eaten, or infected by alien horrors, or have to crawl through toxic waste, trash compactors, minefields, and other dangerous stuff.

Half-Life absolutely blew my mind the first time I watche a friend play it decades ago.  The lengthy train opening sequence setting the scenario and the way the story plays out entirely in first person never wresting control from the player with cutscenes remains a revolutionary experience today, though it may not be as recognizable as such to newcomers who have experienced the hundreds of games that have followed in Half-Life's footsteps since.  Nevertheless it was the original to do these things and as a piece of gaming history cannot be beat, and if you're willing to put up with a bit of oldschool clunkiness here and there it remains a colorful and entertaining experience that is well worth a play.  Not to mention it gives you all the more context for the brilliant sequel.

Este clássico já tem mais de 20 anos de existência e é até dificil dizer que é um dos melhores jogos da Valve, porque todo jogo que essa empresa faz é de alta qualidade (Portal, CS, L4D, Team Fortress, etc..) História muito boa e gameplay frenético, (fica ainda mais no HL2) gráficos bons pra época. 

Nota: 1000/10

Nach ~10 Stunden des endlosen "Maus im Labyrinth aber mit unnötig schwammiger Steuerung und Aliens die keinen Spaß verstehen" Spiels kann ich nur folgendes sagen:

Negativ: 
Das Spiel ist alt und man merkt es deutlich.
Die Steuerung ist so schwammig, man könnte meinen Freeman ist 24/7 betrunken, dennoch gibt es unzählige Passagen die ohne gute Koordination extrem frustrierend werden.

Neutral: 
Die Waffenauswahl ist herrlich groß, zu groß für meinen Geschmack da man am Ende sowieso nur die Besten 3-5 verwendet und das Ewige durchscrollen der Liste auf dauer schon etwas nervt.
Die Gegner verstehen keinen Spaß, stecken ordentlich prügel ein und teilen noch mehr aus. HL trieft förmlich vor Gegnern die, entweder in dunklen Ecken lauernd oder sich direkt vor deiner Nase teleportierend, nur darauf warten dir den Arsch zu versohlen.
Die Story ist durchaus gelungen, dennoch wird sie meiner Meinung nach nur schlecht vermittelt.

Positiv(?):
10 Stunden fühlen sich eher an wie 20. (Portal hat das um einiges Besser hingekriegt)

Definitiv Positiv:
HL war ein wichtiger Grundbaustein von Valve.

Persöhnlich kann ich all die Positiven Reviews nicht nachvollziehen, aber ich habe bei HL auch keinen Nostalgiebonus wie viele andere Gamer. Es ist und bleibt ein Spiel das meiner Meinung nach sehr schlecht gealtert ist, weshalb ich es nicht als gutes Spiel empfehlen kann.

Wer so wie ich nur die "Anfänge" von Valve zu "erkunden" will sollte warten bis ein Paket auf Sale ist oder sich die LP auf Youtube ansehen.

the story is great but the main problem i encountered is that its f*cking hard as balls. if you want to finish this game expect some grinding. the second problem i encountered is that most of the time you have no f#cking clue where to go or what to do. this game might've been great in 1998 but it certainly hasn't aged well.  i can see that this might've been a masterpiece back in its day but if you are considering this game then i would only advise you to buy it if you want to have fun with the mods. otherwise you are better off buying black mesa. you have to understand that i dont hate this game, i actually had fun playing it. the shooting is still pretty good and the graphics are fine. this game is perfect for people who game on a potato, even with mods.

[h1]Luego de pensar si hacerle una reseña o no hacerle una reseña, me decidí por escribir sobre lo que no se dice tanto, ya que todo el mundo lo galardona y es inútil que yo venga y haga lo mismo.
[i]Aclaro el juego es bueno, y fue el mejor en su época[/i].[/h1]

[b]La linterna:[/b]
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagman, Lagman, Lagman
Lagman, Lagmanan, Lagman
Da da da da da da da da da da da da da da da da da
Lagman!
Luego de esa demostración de mi inteligencia, puedo hablagr bien, no me extrañaría que este problema fuera por mi PC, pero probé con diferentes configuraciones y siempre el haz de la linterna que ilumina me buguea el juego o me baja los fps. EDIT:Este problemita lo arrgle seleccionando  "software" como mi renderizador dentro del juego en "Opciones" y "Video".

[b]El Objetivo:[/b]
Es característico de este juego perderse luego de hacer algo, supongo que es parte de la magia "Half Life", pero es frustrante. Este punto se lo puede ver de dos maneras la que yo llamaría la manera "Clásica" donde se ve este detalle como un punto a favor del juego y de su gameplay inmersivo, la otra es la "Rage", donde se explica detalladamente y claramente lo que costaba explicar que saltas mas largo agachandote y saltando, mientras corres(Esta mecanica de salto se aprende en la "Sala de entrenamiento", pense que era un tipo de dificultad y nunca la clickeaba"), al igual que ese bicho no se puede matar porque es inmortal, o que no debo matar ese pinche científico.

[h1]Por si aun no quedo claro, el juego es buenisimo, te lo recomiendo comprar junto a sus secuelas/dlc/expansiones/como lo llames, yo simplemente dije las cositas que me molestaron.[/h1]

Soy un [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30566290-%C2%ABWeLoveBlu%C2%BB/]"Mentor"[/url] y agradecería que me siguieras, hago criticas extensas(Hay casos en los que no, por razones especificas), verdaderas y solo analizo juegos que les haya dedicado tiempo.

You play as Gordon Freeman, a scientist at the Black Mesa Research Facility, conducting dangerous and top secret genetic experiments. Without giving away too much of the story let me just say that, after a freak accident (or was it an accident…), you find yourself battling amongst unearthly creatures in an effort to free yourself, save yourself from government troops, and to eventually save the world. The story is revealed through dialogues with other scientists, overheard conversations, and other various clues discovered throughout the game.

Unlike other first person shooters (FPS), the story is not abandoned in the
middle of the game for bigger weapons and constant mayhem (a la Unreal).
Ambient music does an awesome job at setting the tone, and a barrage of sound
effects seriously compliments the single player http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/32731-half-life-not-half-bad-review#G5LCH4s08XrRCmCz.99

Well... Half-life is a classic.
A very good game when it comes to gameplay and a large variety of levels.
It is fun and even when you're being ountnumbered, outpowered, the game is still not rage inducing nor boring.

And storywise... er, the game has one but... let me sum it up :
Your a top-secret area-51-like facility employe. one day you go to work and, Oh no ! Huge transdimensional space breach ! You Morg... Gordon Freeman are the only one who can stop this terrib-
AlienBoomSoldierRatatataExplosionAlienBeeBasedWeaponThatAreWayMoreEfficientAgainstYourselfButWhatever.

No, Seriously : It's a good game. But i'm not sure the story is why you should buy it.

TL;DR : Good Game. But you probably should wait for sales in order to have this game along with 18 other games for nearly nothing !

It feels strange writing a review on a game 20 years late, but I thought it had to be done anyway. Half-Life is one of those games that you either played before it became so popular among the community or 10 to 20 years after it came out. One which you kill hordes of aliens with your crowbar and vast arsenal that you can somehow carry inside of a not so spacious H.E.V suit, climb ladders backwards with no hands and still shoot a fully automatic weapon, and somehow have a PhD in "Theoretical Physics" which grants you knowledge of every gun in existance, even those of alien origin.

PROS:

➤ It's a classic, you're almost obligated to play it.
➤ Very creative and original concept and story.
➤ Insane amount of mods and games adapted from original engine.

CONS:

➤ The game has not aged well if you compare it to todays graphics.
➤ Can get repetitive if you are playing for the first time.
➤ Controls are a bit different from what most games have today.

In conclusion I rate Half-Life a solid 8/10 (2018 standards). On a side note, if the graphics are too old for you then the "Black Mesa" mod is avalible for free download or the "Black Mesa" game is avalible on the Steam store for $15 at the time of this review.

Fun game with a great story, but gameplay wise it shows its age. A lot of first person platforming bogs down an otherwise great old school FPS. Story wise it starts slow which is nice to see some real pacing, the middle really lags and several ties I was wondering what my actual goal even was, but by the end it really pics up and the goals become clear. 8/10, in it's time probably more like a 9-10 but it shows age in several spots.

This is one of the best games I've played I highly suggest it to anyone of all ages. Challenging at times but in a way that makes the game better.

[b] Story: 5/5 [/b]
You play as Gordon Freeman, an ordinary man thrown into an extraordinary situations due to a science expierement gone awry. The combination of being a silent protagonist and a common man really helps with immersion. Since Gordon has no prior character, you are free to create one yourself. The story is basic (bad science leads to aliens and government tries to hide it) but well told. You and the fellow scientists are pretty much in the dark about outside events for most of the game, creating a sense of chaos since no one knows whats going on. You can make out some of the miltary's struggles through radio messages. [spolier] Eventually, you meet a strange man who may hold all the answers. [/spoiler]

[b] Environments: 4/5 [/b]
Despite the graphics clearly showing their age, the different parts of Black Mesa are still well designed. Each section has a different "theme" to it and are fun to explore as you progress. Xen succeeds in feeling very alien and outlandish, creating a sense of unese in the last levels. 

[b] Gameplay: 5/5 [/b]
Basic FPS style of play with added puzzles. Don't take this wrong, the game was very fun to play. One of my favorite things of the Half-Life series is that every kill felt satisfying. Mix that with challenging and diverse enemies, and you got a great shooter. The puzzles were well designed, subtly blending into the surrounding environment and allowing you to see other parts of the facilities. 

[b] Enemies: 5/5 [/b]
There are two groups of enemies: The Xen aliens and the US military. There is little variation in the soldiers, but they can use heavy weaponry like machine guns and helicopters. They're are also intelligent, being able to coordinate and work to outsmart you, making them a tough opponent. The Xen aliens are more diverse, ranging from the iconic headcrabs to the bulletproof Gargantuas. These variations require you to use different tactics to deal with each different type of alien. 

[b] Weapons: 4/5 [/b]
You start with a crowbar and finish with the firepower of an Army Battalion. While each weapon is unique and fun to use, there were so many available that I had trouble using all them, and thus relied mostly on the basic SMG and shotgun. They were effective against the basic enemies encountered in most levels. Still, the stonger science and alien weapons were nessecary to deal with the stronger foes in Xen, so they had their type to shine.

[b] Overall: 5/5 [/b]
There is a reason this game is classic. Dated graphics do little to subtract from the great gameplay, environments, and story.
I highly recommend.
